channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading 953397 from SCHG around 1am this package was discovered with a wet corner. The package was put in a tote and taken to the haz mat cage for processing. DescribePack: There was no external damage to the outer packaging such as hole or crushed. The lid on the inner bottle was half way open and nothing keeping it from staying closed during transit. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: There was no spill aside from what was on the package and it was taken to the haz mat caged and processed.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in belly of a trailer during Preload shift. It was upside down. Manager removed from trailer, placed into lined damage tote. All other leaked on items kept with package and placed in hazmat bags lined totes and moved to hazmat processing cage. PPE also kept with original package. DescribePack: Leaked from top of container, no other visible damage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediately removed from area and placed in hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2024030355
item.description:
Report E-2024030355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: WOODSTOCK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 11, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted floor and swept them in with hand tools. The one (1) damaged 55-gallon metal drum of paint was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum for further transport. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum for transport and further handling..

item.title: Report E-2024030307
item.description:
Report E-2024030307

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: EAST PEORIA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4in-by-4in area of the trailer floor and cardboard packaging and estimated that two (2) ounces of material was released due to a weld failure on one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Enviroserve personnel transferred the remaining product into two (2) 275-gallon poly tote and shipped on to the consignee. The released material was scrapped from the trailer floor and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail along with impacted cardboard from the other freight. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030316
item.description:
Report E-2024030316

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: EAST MOLINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 5ft-by-5ft area of the terminal concrete floor and estimated that one-hundred and thirty (130) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel transferred the remaining product from the damaged tote along with rinse water that was used to neutralize two (2) 85-gallon metal drums that Dayton terminal personnel used to collect the leaking product in prior to the contractor’s arrival. The rinse water was offloaded into one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted flooring and collected the spent absorbents and containerized it along with impacted debris into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024030136
item.description:
Report X-2024030136

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: Centreville
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024030136: Tank car releasing vapor from both vapor valves and liquid valve. All three valves in open position and plugs less than tool tight. Valves were closed and plugs tightened. X-2024030139: Liquid valve and A end vapor valve found with vapor release. Both valves in open position with plugs less than tool tight. Liquid valve plug had insufficient tape to properly secure plug. Both valves were closed. Liquid valve plug re-taped then both plugs tightened properly. X-2024030140: Liquid valve found releasing vapor past the plug. Valve in open position, plug had insufficient tape to secure and plug less than tool tight. Valve was closed, plug re-taped then plug tightened. X-2024030141: Odor of leaking car from ground. Inspection found liquid valve and A end vapor valves in open position with plugs less than tool tight. Both valves were closed and plugs tightened.

item.title: Report X-2024030444
item.description:
Report X-2024030444

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading trailer 557169 from SCHG the haz mat was discovered wet and had leaked onto another haz mat package. Both haz mats were put in totes and taking to the Haz Mat cage for inspection. DescribePack: Found a crack on the damaged bottle. On the inside of the handle the seam is cracked about an inch or more. Hard to see the crack initially. The outer package was so damaged from the leak that the top half of the box was gone. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: There was no more leaking once package was found. Cleaned up any mess leftover and put all bottles upright in totes and put in hazmat cage.
